column4: hey guys anyone using icewm on ubuntu Hoary?  I needed help editing the menu config file.  I don't know where to go
<---noob
have you looked at your hidden homedir dirs?
you'll have to elaborate
open a terminal, and type "ls -a|more" and look for .icewm or something similar
I have .icewm there
so in the terminal, type "file .icewm" and see what it is
it says file.icewm
file is a command to tell you what some file is
so in the term you are asking "file .icewm" to find out what kind of data .icewm is
my fault its a directory is what is came up as
so in the terminal (or you can add .icewm to the end of the url in nautilus) type "cd .icewm"
then you'll find your settings files
you're my hero
if it's in your $PATH, "limewire.jar" should do it
obviously I switched to icewm and now my limewire icon is gone and  I don't know the command  I opened a terminal and typed "limewire.jar" didn't work
so do what ^thehatsrule^ suggested
what to you mean standalone/
I just wanted it without the gnome involved
so use the "K desktop Manager" or kdm
small clean system just ubuntu and xfce4.  But I can wait til I am more knowledgable
the "gnome desktop mangager" isnt "gnome"
whats the difference?
not enough to discuss, they both offer similar experience
